column4: SATA and ATA use different connections to connect to motherboard, right?
Man, I just spent an hour driving to a friends house to get this damned ATA HDD and i got back and discovered that the HDD i have in there already is SATA :(
ATA is an interconnect protocol that can occur over several different connections.  SATA is one, IDE is another.
they make adaptors from PATA to SATA, USB, Firewire, even SCSI
